column4: Facebook launches video chat with Skype
column5: PALO ALTO  California Facebook will add Skype video chat to its pages  aiming to spice up the appeal of the world's No. 1 Internet social networking service while fending off increased competition from Google. | Video

column5: SEOUL  July 7 Samsung Electronics   the world's top maker of memory chips and televisions  estimated its April-June operating profit would fall 26 percent year on year  as its LCD display business is widely expected to report another loss.

column4: Hackers expose flaw in Apple iPad  iPhone software
column5: BOSTON Hackers have disclosed a bug in software from Apple Inc that security experts said could be exploited by criminals looking to gain remote control over iPhones  iPads and iPod Touch devices.

column5: * They could develop malware that lets them control devices

column4: Murdoch defends papers as Cameron pledges hacking probe
column5: LONDON Rupert Murdoch promised full cooperation on Wednesday to resolve a scandal shaking his media empire after British Prime Minister David Cameron promised an inquiry into what he called "disgusting" phone hacking by a newspaper.

column4: UPDATE 8-Murdoch defends papers as Cameron pledges hacking probe
column5: * Cameron  friend of former editor  says there should be phone-hacking inquiry

column4: UPDATE 1-YRC shares skid  ABF jumps on appeals court ruling
column5: NEW YORK  July 6 A federal appeals court has given new life to a rival's lawsuit against top U.S. trucker YRC Worldwide Inc   jeopardizing the company's restructuring efforts and sending its shares plummeting more than 8 percent.

column4: AB InBev to invest $703 million in Argentina 2011-2015
column5: BUENOS AIRES Quilmes beer and malt company  part of the world's largest brewer Anheuser-Busch InBev   will invest 3 billion pesos ($703 million) in Argentina between 2011 and 2015  the government said on Wednesday.

column5: SAN FRANCISCO/NEW YORK Transocean Ltd evacuated 108 nonessential personnel from a deepwater rig working off Ghana for Eni SpA after it took on water on Wednesday.

column4: Exxon says Montana pipeline repairs to take weeks
column5: HOUSTON  July 6 Exxon Mobil Corp  is working on a plan to repair and restart a ruptured Montana pipeline that spilled up to 1 000 barrels of crude into the Yellowstone River last weekend  but restoration is not expected for at least two weeks  an executive said on Wednesday.

column4: Government facilities targets of cyber attacks
column5: BOSTON Two U.S. government-funded research laboratories and a defense contractor were targets of a "highly sophisticated" cyber attack last week  representatives of the organizations said  the latest in a string of assaults on U.S. interests.

column4: UPDATE 3-U.S. govt facilities targets of cyber attacks

column4: TEXT-S&P Assigns 'BBB-' To Quad/Graphics' $1.5B Cred Facilities
column5: 7 July  2011-- Standard & Poor's Ratings Services said today that it assigned its (unsolicited) issue ratings to Quad/Graphics Inc.'s proposed credit facilities. Quad/Graphics intends to put in place a $1.5 billion first-lien credit facility  consisting of an $800 million revolving credit facility  a $400 million term loan A  and a $300 million term loan B. We assigned the new first-lien facilities an issue-level rating of 'BBB-' (one notch above the corporate credit rating on the company).

column4: Sotheby's fetches $43 million for Guardi Venice view
column5: LONDON  - Sotheby's sold a view of Venice by Francesco Guardi for 26.7 million pounds ($42.9 million) on Wednesday  and said it was the highest price for any work of art sold at an international auction house this year.
